definition: to take a picture of a person without permission or without their knowledge
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)

sentences.english: Take a candid shot of WeiSheng shitting and he will give you the smell of a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 偷拍多多大便，他会放一生难忘的臭屁给你闻。

sentences.english: Thank you for your sharing. It's a very good picture.
sentences.chinese: 不错，偷拍我喜欢，谢谢楼主发片，坚决支持你。

sentences.english: Wang went to the waste house to send gold bars, along the way was Yao Bangyan candid camera.
sentences.chinese: 王蝶衣去废屋送金条，一路上被姚邦彦偷拍。

sentences.english: Lindsay has flashed onlookers a number of times in cars and clubs.
sentences.chinese: 林赛不止一次在酒吧或车里与观众暧昧而被偷拍。

sentences.english: It meant 45)paparazzi on set every day.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着每天在片场被狗仔队偷拍。

sentences.english: Star privacy by videotaping has repeatedly occurred.
sentences.chinese: 明星隐私被偷拍已多次发生。

sentences.english: Perhaps it's a way of preventing unauthorised knicker -flashing.
sentences.chinese: 也许这是一种应付被偷拍的办法。

sentences.english: We have secretly videotaped the whole process of this illegal transaction.
sentences.chinese: 我们偷拍到了这次非法交易的全过程。

sentences.english: These candid camera-type programs have gone too far.
sentences.chinese: 这种偷拍式的节目太过火了。

definition: to peep/to peek/to act as voyeur
to document on film the course of events/to follow sb with a camera
to take a picture or video of oneself/to take a selfie/selfie
to take advantage of sb/to freeload
